response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Sum of Divisors\", \"description\": \"Given a positive integer, write a function that calculates the sum of all its divisors. The function should return 0 for input 1.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef sum_of_divisors(n: int) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): A positive integer.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the sum of all divisors of the input integer.\\n\", \"code\": \"def sum_of_divisors(n: int) -> int:\\n    if n == 1:\\n        return 0\\n    total = 0\\n    for i in range(1, n+1):\\n        if n % i == 0:\\n            total += i\\n    return total\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert sum_of_divisors(12) == 28\", \"assert sum_of_divisors(27) == 30\", \"assert sum_of_divisors(1) == 0\", \"assert sum_of_divisors(4) == 7\"] }"
